body:
I was just wondering if people would be interested in me making one of or all of these vids. I may include a beginner's and mid-advanced PvP guide(s) sometime. I may also teach a type of strafe I use. I'm not sure if the technique belongs to anyone else but I haven't seen it used before anywhere or by anyone I've faced. So Kohi Montage/Combo-and-Strafe-tage/PvP Guides. If anyone would like to see those videos come out on my channel please comment below. I'd you have any requests for which PvP technique you want me to teach comment saying which. Certain ones are top secret and others I'd be willing to give away. 

Thanks, 

-ShadowSlayerZ7

replies.body: Could you do a video on soup tactics.  Just got into soup pvp today.  And it isn't a pretty sight.
replies.body_tagged: Could you do a video on soup tactics.  Just got into soup pvp today.  And it isn't a pretty sight.

replies.body: I can give general tips. I'm not a soup PvPer. If you want top-teir soup tips, ask croc. He's amazing at soup. I can give a few tips though. Learn how to hotkey and always Jeep your eye on your hearts cuz they TANK in soup. Blockhitting is useful if you can incorperate it well. Don't just shift and blockhit and expect to win. If you're getting combo'd turn and run, jump so you get knocked out of their combo, or blockhit. Blockhitting is very good for countering and breaking combos as well. If you watched my 1v1 with Crusty, at 5:55 I blockhit and proceed to counter-combo him. Just some tips

replies.body: Why I play pot more is because the multitasking takes away from my concentration on the fight, making me play worse. I'm good at multitasking but I'd rather preform better.
